name: Replication Data for: Opportunistic evaluation of modelled sea ice drift using passively drifting telemetry collars in Hudson Bay, Canada
description: Opportunistic evaluation of modelled sea ice drift using passively drifting telemetry collars in Hudson Bay, Canada. The Cryopshere. Ron R. Togunov, Natasha J. Klappstein, Nicholas J. Lunn, Andrew E. Derocher, Marie Auger-Méthé. Files contain information on drifting polar bear collars used to assess the motion of 20 passively drifting high-accuracy GPS telemetry collars originally deployed on polar bears, Ursus maritimus, in western Hudson Bay, Canada to validate a widely used sea ice drift dataset produced by the National Snow and Ice Data Centre (NSIDC).

citation.text: Ron R. Togunov, Natasha J. Klappstein, Nicholas J. Lunn, Andrew E. Derocher, Marie Auger-Méthé. In review. Opportunistic evaluation of modelled sea ice drift using passively drifting telemetry collars in Hudson Bay, Canada. The Cryosphere.

distribution.name: Drifting_collar_id_and_location_data.tab
distribution.description:
Field - description - units
Xnumber	- Unique identifier for a collared polar bear - N/A

Deployed	- The year in which a telemetry collar was deployed on a polar bear -	YYYY

drop.date - date and time that a collar was determined to have dropped off the polar bear and begun passively drifting -	YYYY-MM-DD hh

method - method by which the dropped collar was identified. ‘manual’ represents collars identified by manually comparing collar displacement with satellite imagery of sea ice. ‘mortality signal’ represents collars identified by an activity switch in the collar that was triggered by prolonged and sustained inactivity.  - ‘manual’ or ‘mortality signal’

loc_date_time - Date of GPS location obtained by telemetry collar.	- YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm
Easting - X coordinate* - Projected meters
Northing - Y coordinate*	- Projected meters

*Projected in NAD83(CSRS) / Teranet Ontario Lambert projection (EPSG:5321)
